review_blob: Bottle 50cl. Love the label. Amber, white bubbly head - disappears very quickly. Weak aroma, yeast and some fruits, sweet and a bit spicy. In taste its similar, fruits, sweetness, bit spicy, noticeable alcohol. A bit creamy with spicy bitter aftertaste. Nice but should be more intense - I wish its like the label - naughty and modern in this old, classic style.

Bottle 50cl. Quite pretty, golden with nice, white head. Aroma is mostly citrus with some fuzzy smell. The same fuzzy-coconut-vegetables flavors in taste but covered by citrus, yeast and nice hoppy bitterness which is long lasting but not to strong. Basically nice (if you ignore the vegetables) and drinkable but to flat.

Tap. Brown with nice, light head. Aroma is weak, mostly roasted and sweety chocolate. In taste it?s delicate, milk chocolate, a bit roasted and also a bit sour. Quite dry, to high carb imo. Bitter finish. Much more porter than wheat but a little bit to weak, reminds me some smooth schwarzbier. Quite enjoyed it but would like more body.

Bottle, 33cl. Very dark brown, hazy, brown foam. Aroma: chocolate, coffee, roast, earthy, quite complex, strikes just after opening. Taste: Chocolate and coffee, light sweetness, medium bitterness; full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, warming, Complex and intense, worth the price, cant wait to check barrel aged version! (archive rating).

Tap. Pitch black with small creamy head, thick ring is present till the end. Aroma filled with prunes, raisins, loads of chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Similar in taste, in addition cherries in chocolate, sweetness, and lots of lots of dark chocolate. Warming alcohol is present. Bitter, chocolate finish. Very heavy, oily, liqueury, soft carb. 
Very nice but still I would appreciate some more bourbon barrel flavors, I think it kinda got lost it in the chocolate.
